originalTitle: This woman fought back when jihadists killed her sons
title: A Brave Mom's Story: Never Giving Up Hope!
content:
Hi everyone! It's your friendly reporter, Pendo, here to share a very important story from our amazing continent, Africa. Today, we meet a super brave mom named Yameogo Aminata. Her story shows us how strong love can be, even when sad things happen.

Meet Aminata and Her Family

Aminata is a loving mom. She had four wonderful sons and a sweet daughter. They lived in a place where families play and laugh together, just like yours! Aminata loved her children very, very much. They were her whole world, full of joy and sunshine. But one day, something very sad happened. Some bad people, who make a lot of trouble, came to her village. These people are called 'jihadists.' They hurt many innocent people. Aminata's four sons were taken away and killed. Her dear daughter is also missing, which means no one can find her. Imagine how sad Aminata must have felt.

What Are Jihadists? (A Simple Explanation)

Sometimes, there are people who believe their way is the only way to live, and they want everyone to follow them. They use force and scare people. We call these groups 'jihadists.' They make places unsafe and cause a lot of sadness. But remember, most people in Africa and all over the world want peace and kindness! **Did You Know?** Africa is a huge continent with 54 different countries! Millions of wonderful, peaceful people live here, just like you and your family. It's full of diverse cultures, beautiful landscapes, and amazing animals.

Aminata's Big Brave Heart

Even though Aminata was so, so sad, she didn't give up. She had a very big, brave heart. When we say she 'fought back,' it doesn't mean she used her fists. It means she found strength inside her. She decided to speak out. She wanted everyone to know what happened. She wanted to tell her story so that maybe, just maybe, no other mom would have to feel her pain. Her courage helps people understand the problems in her community. **Did You Know?** Being brave doesn't always mean being super strong physically. It can also mean being strong inside, speaking up, and never giving up hope, even when things are very tough! It means doing the right thing, even when it's scary.

Why Bad Things Happen Sometimes

Sometimes, different groups of people disagree, and they can't find a way to talk nicely. Then, some people make very bad choices and decide to hurt others. This is called conflict. It makes many families sad and sometimes forces people to leave their homes to find safety. We call these people 'displaced' or 'refugees.' They are looking for a safe place to live, often in a different part of their own country or in another country entirely. It's very hard for them to leave their homes and friends behind. **Did You Know?** There are many people around the world who have had to leave their homes because of conflict. Helping them feel welcome and safe is a kind thing to do.

The Power of Hope and Community

In Africa, people are very good at helping each other. When sad things happen, neighbors and communities come together. They share food, offer comfort, and give a helping hand. This shows that even in sad times, kindness and love are always there. Aminata's community likely supported her too, giving her strength to keep going. They remind her that she is not alone. This togetherness is a very special part of life in Africa. **Did You Know?** Many African cultures believe in 'Ubuntu,' which means 'I am because we are.' It's a beautiful idea about how we are all connected and should care for each other! It teaches us that we are stronger together.

Speaking Up for Peace

Aminata's choice to speak out is a very brave act. She is telling the world that what happened was wrong. She wants a world where children can grow up safe, playing and learning, without fear. She reminds us all that we must stand up for peace and kindness. She wants justice for her sons and hopes her daughter can one day be found. Her voice is powerful, helping others to understand the importance of peace and safety for everyone.

What Can We Learn?

Aminata's story teaches us that love is strong, and a mother's love is incredibly powerful. It also shows us that even when bad things happen, we can find courage. We can speak up, help others, and never stop hoping for a better, safer world. Every little act of kindness helps make our world a brighter place. So, remember Aminata. Remember her strength. And remember that all of us, even kids, can help spread kindness and hope. That's all for today from your friend, Pendo! Stay kind, stay safe!
summary: Yameogo Aminata, a brave mom in Africa, lost her four sons and her daughter is missing because of bad people called jihadists, but she found the courage to speak out and hope for peace.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows us that even when very sad and unfair things happen, people can be incredibly brave, speak up for what is right, and never give up hope for a safer, kinder world for everyone.

title: Big News from Zimbabwe: Will Our President Stay Longer?
content:
Hello, amazing friends! It's me, your kid-friendly news reporter, coming to you live from our wonderful continent of Africa! Today, we have some exciting and important news from a beautiful country called Zimbabwe. It's a place with big elephants, mighty waterfalls, and very kind people! In every country, we have a special leader called a President. Think of a President like the head teacher of a very big school, or the captain of a super big sports team! Their job is to help everyone in the country, make sure things run smoothly, and keep everyone safe and happy. In Zimbabwe, our current President is named Mr. Mnangagwa. We sometimes call him President Mnangagwa. He's been working hard to lead the country.

What is a President's Job?

So, what does a President do? They help make important decisions for the country. They make sure there are schools for you to learn in, hospitals if you get sick, and roads for cars to drive on. It's a very big job, just like managing a giant family! Did you know? Most countries have a President or a Prime Minister! These leaders are chosen by the people of the country. It's like everyone votes for their favourite person to be the leader! Imagine you have a turn to be the leader of your class for a week. You get to help decide games or story time! A President does this for a whole country, but for much longer than a week! They lead millions of people.

Time Limits for Leaders

Now, here's something very interesting about the President's job. Just like when you play a game and each player gets a turn, Presidents also have a special 'turn' or a set amount of time they can be the leader. This 'turn' is called a 'term in office'. It means they have a certain number of years they can be President. In Zimbabwe, President Mnangagwa's current term, or his turn, is set to finish in a few years, in the year 2028. It's like having a timer on a game. When the timer goes 'ding!', your turn is usually over. This helps make sure new people get a chance to lead and bring new ideas. Did you know? In many countries, a President can only serve for two terms, which means two turns! This rule helps keep things fair and gives different leaders a chance to help the country with fresh thoughts and plans.

A New Idea: Staying Longer?

But guess what? Some people in Zimbabwe are talking about a new idea! They are saying, 'What if President Mnangagwa could stay as President for longer than 2028?' It's like when you're playing your favourite game, and someone says, 'Hey, maybe we can play one more round, even if the timer usually stops now!' It's a big discussion! This new idea is written down on a special paper called a 'bill'. A 'bill' is like a big suggestion or a proposal for a new rule. It's not a rule yet, but it's an idea that people are thinking about very seriously. These people who want him to stay longer think President Mnangagwa is doing a great job. They believe he should continue his work to help Zimbabwe grow and become even better. They feel he still has many good plans to finish for all the citizens. Did you know? Making a new rule or changing an old one is a very important process! Many people have to talk about it, vote on it, and agree to it before it becomes a real rule for everyone to follow.

Why Are Rules Important?

Think about your classroom. You have rules, right? Like 'listen to the teacher' or 'share your toys'. These rules help everyone get along and make sure things are fair and safe. Rules are super important for a whole country too! They help everyone know what to expect and how things should work. They make sure the country is organized and peaceful for everyone, from little kids to grandparents. When we talk about changing a rule for the President's job, it's a very big deal. It means thinking carefully about why the original rule was there, and what might happen if it changes. People need to talk and think very deeply. Some people might feel happy about the idea because they like the current President. Other people might wonder if it's fair to change the rules, especially rules about how long a leader can stay in their important job. It's like when you're playing a game, and someone suggests changing a rule in the middle of the game. Everyone needs to talk about it and decide if it's a good idea for fairness and fun for all players!

What Happens Next?

So, what happens with this new idea, this 'bill', that wants President Mnangagwa to stay longer? Well, it's not a final rule yet. It's just a beginning of a big conversation and a long process. The people who help make laws in Zimbabwe, who are like the big rule-makers, will talk about this 'bill'. They will discuss it, think about it, and decide if it's a good idea for the country and all its people. They will listen to what many people think. They will make sure they are doing what is best for all the people of Zimbabwe, including all of you amazing kids who will grow up there! It's like when your family discusses what to have for dinner. Everyone shares their ideas, and then you decide together what's best for everyone to enjoy and agree upon! Did you know? Zimbabwe is famous for its incredible natural beauty, like Victoria Falls! It's one of the largest waterfalls in the world and it's absolutely breathtaking! It's a true wonder of Africa.

A Message for Our Young Leaders

This news reminds us that leadership is a very big responsibility. And even though you are kids, you are also future leaders! Learning about how countries work helps you understand the world around you. It's important to ask questions, to listen to different ideas, and to think about what is fair and good for everyone. These are super skills for any future leader, just like you! So, let's keep our eyes and ears open to what happens in Zimbabwe. We will keep you updated on this important story as it develops. Thank you for listening, my wonderful friends! Remember to always be curious and keep learning about our amazing continent of Africa and the world! See you next time for more kid-friendly news!
summary: Some people in Zimbabwe want their President, Mr. Mnangagwa, to stay in his job for longer than his current turn, which is set to end in 2028, and they have made a special suggestion called a 'bill' about it.
whyMatters: This is important because changing how long a leader can stay in power affects everyone in the country, like how rules in a game change the way we play, and it means people need to talk carefully about what is best and fair for the future of Zimbabwe.

title: A President's Safe Flight: A Story from Far Away!
content:
Hello, My Awesome Friends in Africa!

Hello, my awesome friends in Africa! Your friendly news reporter is here with a very important story from a land far, far away. It's about a brave leader and a scary moment that ended happily. Our story is about President Gustavo Petro. He is the leader of a country called Colombia. Just like the presidents we have in our own countries here in Africa, President Petro works very hard for all the people in Colombia. He tries to make sure things are good for them, helps them with schools, and works to keep everyone safe and happy.

What is a Helicopter?

One day, President Petro was travelling in a big, special machine called a helicopter. Do you know what a helicopter is? It's like a super cool flying car! It has big spinning blades on top that help it lift off the ground and fly very high in the sky. Helicopters are amazing because they can go places where cars can't easily go, like over tall mountains or big, thick forests. They can also land in small spaces, which is very helpful for busy leaders. President Petro was using the helicopter to fly from one town to another in his country. Leaders often travel a lot to meet people and see how things are going in different parts of their country.

A Scary Moment in the Sky

While President Petro was flying high in the helicopter, something very scary happened. Some people, who were doing a very wrong thing, tried to shoot at his helicopter! Imagine that! Someone trying to hurt a leader who is working hard for everyone in his country. This kind of very sad event is sometimes called an "assassination attempt." It means someone tried to hurt or even kill a very important person. It's a very bad and wrong thing for anyone to do, especially when it's aimed at a leader who is trying to help their country. But guess what? The helicopter was strong, and the people inside were safe! The shots did not hurt anyone. This is very good news and we are so happy about it! President Petro was okay, and all the people with him in the helicopter were okay too. Phew! Everyone can breathe a sigh of relief that he and his team are safe and sound.

Why Are Leaders Important?

Did you know that presidents and leaders are very, very important for a country? They are like the captains of a big ship, or like the head teacher of a big school. They help steer the country in the right direction. They make rules to help people live together, help build new schools and hospitals, and try to make sure people have jobs. They also work very hard to make sure everyone lives in peace and harmony. When a leader is safe, it means they can continue to do their important work for their country without fear. It's just like when your teacher is safe, they can continue teaching you wonderful things in school! We all want our leaders, here in Africa and everywhere else, to be safe so they can help their people.

Did You Know? Fun Facts!

* **Did you know?** Colombia is a beautiful country very far away from Africa. It's on a different continent called South America. It's famous for its tall, beautiful mountains, delicious coffee, and colourful birds! It's a place with lots of amazing nature. * **Did you know?** The very first helicopter that could fly and carry a person was invented a long, long time ago, even before your grandparents were born! It was in the year 1907. But they became much more common many years later. * **Did you know?** Leaders often have special helpers called security guards to keep them safe. This is because their work is so important, and sometimes some people might not agree with them. But hurting people is never the right answer. * **Did you know?** President Gustavo Petro is very special because he is the first-ever leader from a certain group of ideas called the "left-wing" party in Colombia. This means he has different ideas about how to help people, especially people who are poor, than leaders who came before him. He wants to bring more fairness to everyone in his country.

Staying Safe is Super Important

It's very important for everyone to be safe, especially our leaders who work so hard for us. When people try to hurt others, it makes everyone sad and scared. But thankfully, President Petro is safe and sound! He can continue his very important work for the people of Colombia. This story reminds us that even though there can be difficult times in the world, good people always wish for peace and safety for everyone. We all hope that leaders everywhere, from Africa to Colombia, can do their work safely and make their countries wonderful places to live. Let's always choose kindness and peace, my friends! Because being kind makes the world a better place for all of us.
summary: President Gustavo Petro of Colombia is safe after his helicopter was shot at by bad people while he was flying, but luckily no one was hurt.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows that even leaders need to be kept safe so they can do their important work for everyone in their country, and we are happy he is okay.

title: Kenya's Brave Story: Fighting for Freedom!
content:
Hello Friends! A Story from Africa!

Hi everyone! Welcome to our news report from the amazing continent of Africa! Today, we're going on a special journey to a beautiful country called Kenya. It's a place with sunny skies, amazing animals, and a very important history. We're going to learn about some super brave people and why their story still helps us understand the world today. Are you ready for an adventure into the past?

Who Were the Mau Mau?

Long, long ago, Kenya was not a free country. People from a land far away, called the British, were in charge. They made many rules for the people of Kenya. Many Kenyans felt this was not fair at all. They wanted to lead their own country and make their own choices. They wanted to be free! So, a group of very brave people stood up. They were called the Mau Mau. The Mau Mau wanted Kenya to be a free country. They believed that Kenyans should rule Kenya, not people from another land. They loved their land and their people very much. They decided to fight for what was right. Did you know? The name "Mau Mau" became famous all around the world for these brave freedom fighters!

What Was Colonial Rule?

What does it mean when another country rules yours? Imagine someone comes to your house and tells you exactly how to live, even though it's your home! That's a bit like what "colonial rule" was. The British came from very far away and built many farms and towns in Kenya. But they also made the local Kenyan people work for them. They took a lot of land that belonged to the Kenyans. This was called "colonial rule" because one country was controlling another. The Kenyans wanted to be "self-governing," which means they wanted to rule themselves! They wanted to decide their own future, like any country should. Did you know? Kenya celebrates its Independence Day on December 12th every year! That's the day Kenya became a free country in 1963. It's a very happy day for all Kenyans!

How Did They Fight for Freedom?

The Mau Mau wanted to make their voices heard. They wanted the British to leave Kenya and let Kenyans be free. They used different ways to show that they were unhappy and that they wanted their country back. Sometimes they had secret meetings to plan. Sometimes they tried to make the British feel uncomfortable so they would leave. It was a very long and difficult fight for them. Many people showed incredible bravery and courage. They believed with all their hearts in a free Kenya. They never gave up their dream of having their own country back, where their own people could make the rules and take care of their land. Did you know? The national animal of Kenya is the lion! Lions are known for being very strong, brave, and protective, just like the Mau Mau fighters who protected their country.

The Difficult Times: When Things Were Hard

The British rulers did not want to give up control easily. They tried very strong ways to stop the Mau Mau and anyone who supported them. This is what we call "repression." It means trying very hard to stop people from doing something, even if what they want is fair and right. They put many Mau Mau fighters and people who helped them into special camps. These camps were often not very nice places to be. People were stopped from speaking their minds freely, and they couldn't gather together to talk about their plans for freedom. The British wanted to make sure that no one else would join the Mau Mau. It was a very tough time for the Mau Mau and the Kenyan people. But even during these hard times, many still held onto hope and the dream of a free Kenya. They knew that freedom was worth fighting for. Did you know? Some of the brave Mau Mau fighters were women too! Everyone, men and women, wanted freedom for their beautiful country.

Why This Story Matters Today: Looking at Protests

Now, you might be thinking, why is this old story important for us right now, today? Well, a very smart lady named Chao Tayiana Maina helps us understand this. She studies history and how it connects to today. Chao Tayiana Maina says that sometimes, even today, people all around the world might protest. They protest when they feel things are unfair or when they want to make things better in their countries. And sometimes, the ways that people try to stop these protests can look a little bit like the old ways used against the Mau Mau. For example, when people are not allowed to speak freely or when rules are made to stop people from gathering together peacefully, it reminds us of those difficult times in Kenya's history. It's super important to remember history so we can spot unfairness and stand up for what's right in our own lives and communities. Did you know? "Protest" means to show you disagree with something, usually to help make things better. People often protest peacefully, using their voices to ask for changes.

Learning from History

Learning about the Mau Mau teaches us so many important things. It teaches us about bravery and how amazing people can be when they fight for what they believe in. It teaches us about fighting for what is right, even when it's very difficult. It teaches us that everyone deserves freedom and to be treated fairly, no matter where they live. And it helps us understand why people stand up for themselves and their communities. We can learn to speak up for fairness, listen to others, and work towards a world where everyone is kind and fair to each other. Did you know? The Kenyan flag has a special shield and two spears on it. These symbols stand for protecting freedom and defending the country. It's a powerful reminder of their history!

Remembering the Heroes

The Mau Mau fought very hard for the Kenya we see today – a country that is free and makes its own choices. It's so important to remember their struggle and to honor their bravery. We must always cherish the gift of freedom. Thank you for listening to this incredible and important story from Kenya! It shows us that courage can change the world for the better. Did you know? Kenya is also famous for its incredible safari parks where you can see amazing wildlife like elephants, giraffes, zebras, and many other beautiful animals!
summary: This story is about the brave Mau Mau people in Kenya who fought for their country's freedom from British rule, and why remembering their struggle helps us understand fairness and protests today.
whyMatters: It matters because it teaches us about bravery, freedom, and why it's important to stand up against unfairness, even today, so everyone can be treated fairly.

title: Good News: Our Police Helpers are Working Hard to Find Nancy!
content:
Hello, Little News Friends!

Hello, everyone! It’s your kid-friendly news reporter here. We have some important news for you today. It’s all about how our wonderful police helpers work to keep us safe. They also work hard to find people when they are missing.

Who is Nancy?

You might have heard grown-ups talking about someone named Nancy Guthrie. Nancy is a person that many people are looking for right now. We all want to make sure she is safe and happy. When someone is missing, it means we can’t find them. Everyone hopes they come home soon. Our police are working very, very hard to find Nancy. They are like real-life superheroes!

Police are Our Super Helpers

Our police officers are very special people in our community. They are always ready to help us. They help to make sure that our roads are safe for cars and for children like you. They help if someone gets lost. They also help if there is any kind of problem. They wear uniforms so you can always spot them. They drive cars with bright lights and loud sirens! Did you know? Police cars have those special lights and sirens so they can get to places super quickly when someone needs help! It’s important for them to be fast. When someone like Nancy is missing, the police work extra hard. They ask many questions. They look in many places. They talk to people who might have seen something important. All these little pieces of information help them solve the big puzzle of finding someone.

What Happened with the Man?

Sometimes, when police are looking for clues, they need to talk to lots of different people. They want to ask questions that might help them find the missing person. This helps them learn new things. Recently, our police helpers talked to a man. They met him when he was driving his car. This special meeting is called a "traffic stop." Did you know? A "traffic stop" is when a police officer asks a car to pull over to the side of the road. They might do this to check if everything is okay with the car or to ask someone questions. It helps keep our roads safe. The police talked to this man for a little while. They asked him some important questions about Nancy. They also went to his house. They gently looked around his house for clues. Looking for clues in a house is called "searching." It's like when you search for your favourite toy under your bed! But the police do it very, very carefully. They always look for things that can help.

Good News: The Man Went Home!

After the police talked to the man and looked around his home, they learned something important. They found out that this man was not involved in Nancy being missing. This means he did not know anything about where Nancy was. This is very good news! Because he was not involved, the police let him go home to his family. So, the man went home. This helps the police focus on other clues. They are still working very hard. They are still looking for Nancy. The police are very careful and fair. They only keep talking to people if they think it will really help their search. If someone is not involved, they make sure they can go home. This shows how police are fair to everyone.

How Police Look for Clues

When police search for someone, they do many clever things. They don't just look in one small place. They look everywhere! They might use big maps to see all the places someone could have gone. They also talk to friends and family of the person who is missing. These people know the missing person best. Did you know? Sometimes police use special dogs called K9s! These dogs have amazing noses. They can sniff out clues or even find people who are lost. They are super smart doggy helpers! Police also check special cameras. You know the cameras you see in shops? Or on the road? These are called security cameras. They can sometimes show who was where and when. It’s like watching a real-life video! Every little piece of information, like a picture or a story, is like a puzzle piece. The police try to fit all these pieces together. They work like super detectives! They never ever give up.

Everyone Helps Together

It’s not just the police who help when someone is missing. Everyone in the community tries to help too! Our community is like a big family. Sometimes, people put up posters. These posters have pictures of the missing person. They ask everyone to keep their eyes open and tell a grown-up if they see anything. This is called "community spirit." It means everyone cares about each other and wants to help. If you ever see something that looks strange, or if you think something might be a clue, you can always tell a grown-up. Your parents, your teachers, or any trusted adult will know what to do. They can tell the police. Did you know? It's really important to always tell a trusted grown-up if you are worried or if you see something that makes you feel uneasy. They will always help you and know the best steps to take!

Keeping Everyone Safe

It's very important to remember that our police are always there to keep us safe. They work hard all day and all night. They want everyone in our towns and villages to feel safe. They want you to feel safe when you play outside. If you ever feel lost or scared, you can always look for a police officer. They are your friends. They are your helpers. You can trust them. This news story shows us that police are very, very careful. They check every single clue. Even if a clue doesn't lead to the answer right away, they still check it. They are doing their very best to find Nancy.

Hope for Nancy

So, today we learned that the police talked to a man, and he has gone home because he was not involved. This means the police are still busy looking for Nancy. We all hope that Nancy will be found very soon. We hope she is safe and sound and will be back with her family. Let’s keep hoping and wishing for her safe return. And let’s remember to say a big "Thank You" to our police helpers for all their hard work! They are always looking out for us, just like a big family. We will tell you more news as soon as we hear it. Stay safe and remember to be kind to everyone, little news friends!
summary: Our police helpers talked to a man and then let him go home because he didn't know anything about Nancy Guthrie, and they are still working hard to find Nancy.
whyMatters: This is important because it shows our police helpers are always trying their best to find people who are missing, like Nancy, and make sure everyone in our community is safe and sound.

title: Princes, Police, and Finding the Truth!
content:
Hello, Friends! Your African News Pal Here!

Hello, my amazing friends across Africa! It's your friendly news reporter, here to share some interesting news from a place far, far away. We're going to talk about princes, important people, and why it's always good to tell the truth. Don't worry, we'll keep it super simple and fun! Imagine a world where everyone always tells the truth. That's what we want, right? Today, we're learning about some important grown-ups who are trying to make sure everyone tells the truth, even very special people like princes!

A Big Family Far Away: The Royal Family!

Once upon a time, in a country called the United Kingdom, there is a very special family. This family is called the Royal Family. They live in big, beautiful castles and have important jobs helping their country. You might have seen pictures of them! One person in this special family is called Prince Andrew. He is an uncle to the new King, King Charles. Just like your aunts and uncles, he's part of a big family. Did you know? The United Kingdom is an island country in Europe, very far from Africa. It's famous for its red double-decker buses and big, old castles where kings and queens have lived for hundreds of years!

Important Questions for a Prince

Sometimes, grown-ups have to ask other grown-ups important questions. This helps everyone understand what happened when things are confusing or sad. There was a very, very sad story about a bad man who did wrong things and hurt people. This bad man is no longer around. Police officers are like super-detectives! They work hard to keep everyone safe and find out the truth when bad things happen. They look at clues and talk to people. Prince Andrew knew this bad man a long time ago. Now, some important people are asking Prince Andrew to help the police by telling them everything he knows. They want him to share what he saw or heard, so everyone can understand the truth better. Did you know? Police officers wear uniforms and have special cars. Their job is to make sure everyone follows the rules and stays safe in our communities!

What is "Testifying"?

When someone asks you to tell what you know to help find the truth, that's a bit like 'testifying'. It means sharing your story in a very serious way to help important people, like the police or judges, understand exactly what happened. It's like when your teacher asks you what happened if there's a problem in the playground, and you tell them exactly what you saw. It's very important to tell the truth, always! Even if it's a bit scary or difficult, telling the truth helps everyone. It helps the police do their job and makes sure that everyone can feel safe. Did you know? In some places, when people testify, they put their hand on a special book and promise to tell only the truth! This is to show how serious it is.

Important People from America Want Answers

Now, who are these people asking Prince Andrew to tell his story? They are very important leaders from a country called America. These leaders are called "lawmakers". They help make rules and make sure everyone in their country is safe and happy. These American lawmakers are saying that Prince Andrew should 'testify' or tell what he knows. They believe it's very important for him to share his story to help the police understand everything about the bad man and the sad things that happened. Did you know? America is another big country, even bigger than the United Kingdom! It's famous for very tall buildings and big national parks with lots of animals. It's very far across the ocean from both Africa and the UK!

The King Wants to Help Too!

Remember King Charles? He is Prince Andrew's older brother and the new King of the United Kingdom. The King also thinks it's very important to find out the truth. The King has said that the Royal Family is "ready to support" the police. This means he wants to help the police in any way they need. He wants to make sure that everything is fair and that the truth comes out. It's like when your big brother or sister helps you clean up a mess, even if they didn't make it, because they want to help everyone. Did you know? A king is a very important leader of a country.
